main_name: Helleborus (Rodney Davey Marbled Group) Penny's Pink ('Abcrd01')

botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Ingestion may cause severe discomfort, skin irritant. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Helleborus can be rhizomatous, herbaceous or semi-evergreen perennials forming a clump of pedate basal leaves, or evergreen with erect, leafy stems. Large, bowl-shaped flowers are borne in loose clusters in late winter or spring

how_to_grow.cultivation: Though hardy it may suffer if planted in northerly situations and exposed sites. Thrives in neutral to alkaline soils that are moist, fertile and humus-rich. Partial shade is ideal but can tolerate full sun. Provide shelter from strong, cold winds. Mulch annually in autumn. For more details see hellebore cultivation.
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate named cultivars by division after flowering in early spring or early autumn.
how_to_grow.pruning: Remove faded or damaged foliage as the flowers appear
how_to_grow.pests: Prone to hellebore aphid, hellebore leaf miner and snails
how_to_grow.diseases: May be affected by hellebore leaf spot and hellebore black death virus
